activities.loc: JMB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcos J Davis

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

8:47 AM Defendant Marcos J Davis appeared by video.  Attorney Dan Firkus appeared by video for Marcos J Davis.  Attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for State of Wisconsin.
Covers 22CF132 and 22TR1107
Further reading waived and preliminary hearing requested.  Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Next hearing to be in person.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

I am unable to send an Order for Income Withholding for attorney fees.  The employer listed and the Defendant do not return my calls and  I need more information on where to send it as the PFAC is not clear.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 11, 2022 at 08:45 am.

10:34 AM Defendant Marcos J Davis appeared by video.  Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Marcos J Davis.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS CASES 22CF132 AND 22TR1107

10:34  Court relates and gives appearances.
Court resets both above; must appear in person; NOH to be sent.
Bond to continue.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 8:45 AM before Judge Bitney.  May appear by zoom.

09/21/2022 Clarified outside of court, defendant may appear by zoom for 10/11/2022 hearing.
$25.00/month to begin 11/25/2022 to Attorney Daniel Firkus.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
11:53 AM Defendant Marcos J Davis appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

COVERS 22CF132 & 22TR1107

Court relates.  Blue form presented and Defendant sworn.  Court will appoint an attorney and orders repayment of $25 a month,  starting 11/25/22, by wage assignment. 
Next hearing may be by zoom.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:06 AM Defendant Marcos J Davis appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS CASES 22CF132 AND 22TR1107

10:06  Court questions defendant.  Defendant indicates he completed the blue dean form and returned it to the court.  The form is not on file.
10:08  State relates and asks to reset the AIA. 
10:09   Court orders defendant to come to Justice Center to complete blue dean form; fill it out and submit it before hearing.
Both above reset.
Bond to continue.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Blue form and SASE mailed to Defendant by AJP (see minutes 08/03).

1:26 PM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marcos J Davis appeared by video.  Attorney Alex Kitto appeared by video for Marcos J Davis. 

1:26  Court relates and gives appearances.  Court quashes warrant authorized earlier today.
1:26  Court questions defendant.  Defendant indicates he has tried to contact the Public Defender to determine if he qualifies for their services.  
1:30  Atty. Kitto and Mr. Davis go into break-out room; 1:33 return from break-out room; 1:40 return from break-out room.
1:40  Court questions defendant.
Defendant does not qualify for public defender services.  Defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney.  Form to be mailed to defendant and to be received back by the Court by 8/26/2022.  SASE to be sent along with form to defendant.
AIA set; must  appear either by zoom video or in person.
Bond reinstated.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:03 AM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marcos J Davis not in court. 

State moves for bench warrant; body only; statewide.  Court grants.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:38 AM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marcos J Davis appeared by video. Attorney Steuer appears by zoom video. 

11:19 AM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marcos J Davis appeared by phone. Attorney Steuer appears by zoom video. 

Court will contact Attorney Erdman to see if she will be able to represent. May appear by zoom video for the next hearing. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

1:00 PM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marcos J Davis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Marcos J Davis for today.
Court questions Defendant.  State requests $5,000.00 cash bond.  1:02 Attorney Rockow and Defendant put in a break out room 1:06 Attorney Rockow relates and requests $500.00 cash bond 1:07 Court sets bond.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
